title: Build WorkNest marketplace app with bottom navigation, listings, bookings, and profile (INR + India seed data)

requirements.text: Implement Internet Identity authentication and gate user-specific sections (My Listings, My Bookings, Profile) behind sign-in, while Home remains browseable.

quotes: My profile will show a round dp of the google account by which i logged in ... and sign out

acceptanceCriteria: Unauthenticated users can open Home and view workspace cards and details.
When navigating to My Listings, My Bookings, or Profile while signed out, the UI prompts the user to sign in using Internet Identity.
A visible Sign out action is available when signed in and returns the UI to signed-out state.

requirements.text: Create the core data models and persistence in the Motoko single-actor backend for (a) workspace listings and (b) bookings, with ownership tied to the caller identity.

quotes: Home will have a grid structure which will show display photo of every places available vacant
My listings will show the list of places which i have listed to app
My bookings will be blank untill i book any place

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes methods to: list all available listings; get a listing by id; create a listing (only for signed-in users); list the caller’s own listings; create a booking for a listing (only for signed-in users); list the caller’s bookings; get a booking by id (accessible to booking owner and/or listing owner).

Listings store: id, owner, name/title, location (city/state/address text), hourlyRateINR, amenities (wifi/parking/desk/teaCoffee booleans or tags), description/other details, photo URLs (static asset paths), createdAt.
Bookings store: id, listingId, booker, hours, hourlyRateINRAtBooking, totalPaidINR, bookedAt, and a human-readable time label for display.
All money values are stored as integers in INR (no floating point).

requirements.text: Build a 4-tab bottom navigation layout with these sections: Home, My Listings, My Bookings, Profile; ensure navigation works on mobile viewport and desktop.

quotes: There should be 4 sections at bottom of the screen 1. Home 2. My listings 3. My bookings 4. Profile

acceptanceCriteria: Bottom navigation is persistent and highlights the active tab.
Each tab loads its respective page without full page refresh.
Navigation is usable on narrow screens (no overflow).

requirements.text: Home: render a grid of available workspaces showing a primary display photo and key info (name + city/state + hourly rate in INR). Tapping/clicking a card opens a workspace details view.

quotes: Home will have a grid structure which will show display photo of every places available vacant
On taping on a particular pic It will go inn which will show all photos ... and other details like location, amanities, per hour rate.

acceptanceCriteria: Home displays a responsive grid of workspace cards populated from backend listing data (or seeded data on first run).
Each card shows: image, listing name, location text, and formatted price like “₹250/hr”.
Selecting a card routes to a details screen for that workspace.

requirements.text: Workspace Details: show a photo gallery, location, amenities, per-hour rate (INR), and an hours input. As the user enters hours, compute and display total amount (hourly rate × hours) in INR and show payment option buttons (mock checkout).

quotes: And below that one text box which will ask for number of hours By entering a number there It will give total amount to be paid and options to pay (rate*number of hours)

acceptanceCriteria: Details page shows multiple photos (gallery/carousel) sourced from the listing’s photo URLs.
Amenities are shown clearly (e.g., badges) for wifi, parking, desk, tea/coffee.
Hours input accepts only positive integers; invalid values show an inline validation message and disable payment buttons.
Total displays immediately as “Total: ₹X” where X = hourlyRateINR * hours.
Payment section contains at least 2 mock options (e.g., “Pay with UPI”, “Pay with Card”) and a confirmation step that creates a booking in the backend when confirmed (no real payment integration).

requirements.text: My Listings: display the signed-in user’s listings in a list view with an “Add New” button. Add New opens a form to create a listing with fields: name, hourly rate (INR), location, amenities provided, photos, and other details.

quotes: My listings will show the list of places which i have listed to app ... which will have "add new" button
On taping add new button It will ask details like name, rate, location, amanities provided, other details.

acceptanceCriteria: When signed in, My Listings shows the caller’s listings fetched from backend.
Empty state is shown when the user has no listings, with a clear “Add New” call-to-action.
Add New form validates required fields (at minimum: name, hourly rate, location).
Amenities can be selected (wifi, parking, desk, tea/coffee).
Photos can be selected from a predefined set of bundled images (no external upload requirement).
Submitting creates the listing in backend and returns to the list showing the newly created listing.

requirements.text: My Bookings: show an empty state until the user books a place. After booking, show a list of bookings with place name and booked time; selecting a booking opens a booking detail screen that mirrors workspace details but without payment options and includes hours, rate, and total paid.

quotes: My bookings will be blank untill i book any place
When booked it will show a list format which will say place and time on display
... booking it will show all details ... (this time payment option will not be there and rate*hours and total payment done will be shown)

acceptanceCriteria: Empty state is shown when there are zero bookings.
Bookings list shows each item with listing name + bookedAt/time label.
Booking details screen shows: photo gallery, location, amenities, hourly rate, hours booked, and “Total paid: ₹X”, and does not show payment buttons.
Booking details are loaded from backend using booking id.

requirements.text: Profile: show a round avatar and identity summary for the signed-in user, and provide a menu with: Settings, Edit Profile, Rate Us, Contact Us, Need Help, and Sign Out. Menu items can be placeholder screens/modals except Sign Out which must function.

quotes: My profile will show a round dp ... tapping on that it will show some basic options like settings, edit profile, rate us, contact us, need help, and sign out

acceptanceCriteria: Profile screen shows a circular avatar (generated placeholder is acceptable) and a user identifier (e.g., Internet Identity principal).
Tapping the avatar or a visible “Menu” area opens the list of options requested.
Each option opens a simple placeholder page/modal with English text except Sign Out which signs the user out.
After signing out, user-specific pages return to sign-in prompt state.

requirements.text: Seed the app with initial Indian workspace listings (Ahmedabad, Gujarat and other Indian cities) including realistic amenities, hourly INR rates, and bundled images so the Home grid is populated immediately.

quotes: Use currency of indian rupees and use images and location details of ahmedabad, gujarat more also other indian places

acceptanceCriteria: On first use (or when backend has no listings), the app shows multiple listings with at least: Ahmedabad, Gujarat plus other Indian locations (e.g., Mumbai, Bengaluru, Delhi, Pune, Jaipur).
All prices display in INR with the ₹ symbol and “/hr” formatting.
Each seeded listing has at least 2 photos from bundled static assets.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent visual theme for WorkNest (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) and use it consistently across all screens; avoid a blue/purple primary palette.
acceptanceCriteria: All pages share a consistent header/title style, card style, and spacing scale.
Primary and accent colors are not blue/purple; the palette feels suitable for a professional workspace marketplace.
UI remains readable and usable on mobile-sized screens.

requirements.text: Ensure all user-facing text in the application UI is in English.

quotes: Use English for any user-facing text in the build request.

acceptanceCriteria: No UI labels, buttons, placeholders, or messages appear in a non-English language.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo (no additional backend services).

Do not edit files under frontend immutable paths (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui); compose around them instead.
No real payment gateway integration is required/expected; payment options must be implemented as a mock flow that results in a booking record.
Third-party Google authentication is not supported; use Internet Identity for sign-in while still providing a profile avatar UI.
nonGoals: Implementing real payments (UPI/Card processing) or payment provider integration.
Map/GPS-based nearby search and geolocation features.
Real-time availability updates or chat between seeker and provider.
Featured listings, subscriptions, corporate partnerships, or commission accounting beyond basic booking creation.
